section.title: Overview
section.para: A barycenter is the center of mass of two or more objects and is located under the Solar System folder in the resource tree. The Barycenter object allows you to create a special point that can be used as a reference point or a point to be used for the plots.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: Interacts with the barycenter object selecting it as the origin of the coordinate system or as a primary or secondary point for defining the axes.
It can be selected as a celestial object to be drawn onto the plot, a View Point Reference, or the View Direction within the dialog box.

Under this column are the list of celestial bodies that can be combined to make a barycenter or the center of mass. This list includes: Sun, Mercury, Venus, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, Pluto, Earth, and Luna. As some of these bodies are added to Bodies Selected, they are automatically removed from the list of available bodies. When a body is selected in the Available Bodies column, the right arrow can be clicked to move it to the Bodies Selected column.

The barycenter is calculated using the bodies that are under this column. This column should contain two or more bodies for this object to be effective, unless a body's center of mass is significantly off center. By default, Earth and Luna start in this column. If an object in this column is selected and the left arrow is clicked, that object is cleared from the Body Selected column and moved back to the list of potential bodies used in the Available Bodies column. If the double left arrow is clicked, all of the bodies in the Bodies Selected column are moved to the Bodies Selected column.

programlisting.code: Create Barycenter EarthMoonBary; GMAT EarthMoonBary.BodyNames = {Earth, Luna};

entry.para: The BodyNames field is a list that contains the bodies used to define a barycenter. In a script, the list must be surrounded by curly braces. (i.e. BaryCenterName.BodyNames = { Earth, Luna })
